009package Ch13_Color_Images;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
017import imagingbook.core.plugin.JavaDocHelp;
018import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
019
020import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
021
022/**
023 * <p>
024 * ImageJ plugin, converts an RGB color image to a grayscale image using a specific set of component weights (ITU
025 * BR.709) for calculating luminance (luma) values. See Sec.13.2.1 of [1] for details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer
029 * (2022).
030 * </p>
031 *
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/12/09
034 */
035public class Convert_Rgb_To_Gray implements PlugInFilter, JavaDocHelp {
036                
037        private ImagePlus im;
038
039        /**
040         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
041         */
042        public Convert_Rgb_To_Gray() {
043                if (noCurrentImage()) {
044                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.Flower);
045                }
046        }
047        
048        @Override
049        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
050                this.im = im;
051                return DOES_RGB + NO_CHANGES;
052        }
053
054        @Override
055        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
056                ColorProcessor cp = (ColorProcessor) ip;
057                cp.setRGBWeights(0.2126, 0.7152, 0.0722); // use ITU BR.709 luma weights
058                ByteProcessor bp = cp.convertToByteProcessor();
059                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + " (gray)", bp).show();
060        }
061}
